qa_summary.question: According to the hospitalization records of Clarksville General Hospital, summarize the present illness of O. Myers.
qa_summary.answer: O. Myers' symptoms started 2 weeks ago at home with a gradual onset and no obvious triggers. Main symptoms include palpitations, excessive sweating, and irritability, which have been persistent and worsening. Relief is achieved with rest and beta-blockers. Accompanying symptoms include tachycardia, increased appetite, fatigue, goiter, and exophthalmos. She was previously diagnosed with hyperthyroidism and prescribed methimazole, which provided partial symptom relief. Her general condition has worsened with increased irritability, difficulty sleeping, constant fatigue, and a significant increase in appetite.
